alert.note: Alert for Marion; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Marion and Winston Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 215 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Moulton to near Phil Campbell. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Haleyville, Arley, Double Springs, Addison, Houston Recreational Area, Camp McDowell, Nesmith, Brushy Lake, Poplar Springs, Ashridge, Falls City, Moreland, Smith Lake, Helicon, Inmanfield, Sardis, Corinth Rec Area, Needmore, Winston Free State Barn and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
